2013: :label: prop-scaling-k-v-3
2014:

2016: 
2017: **Local regime ($\rho \to 0$):**
2018: $$
2019: K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d-3})
2020: $$
2021: 
2022: where the $\rho^{6d-3}$ scaling incorporates the $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ factor appearing at each of three derivative orders.
2023: 
2024: **Global regime ($\rho \to \infty$):**
2025: $$
2026: K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d})
2027: $$
2028: 
2029: **Intermediate regime ($0 < \rho < \infty$):**
2030: $$
2031: K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d-3}) \quad \text{(dominant term for small } \rho\text{)}

hints.label: proof-prop-scaling-k-v-3
hints.content:
2037: :label: proof-prop-scaling-k-v-3
2038: 
2039: **Step 1: Trace the ρ-dependence through the pipeline.**
2040: 
2041: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-weight-third-derivative`:
2042: $$
2043: C_{w,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})
2044: $$
2045: 
2046: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-mean-third-derivative`, accounting for the $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ factor from summing over the effective neighborhood:
2047: $$
2048: C_{\mu,\nabla^3}(\rho) = d'''_{\max} + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-1}) + O(d_{\max} \rho^{2d-3})
2049: $$
2050: 
2051: For small $\rho$, the dominant term is $O(\rho^{2d-3})$.
2052: 
2053: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-variance-third-derivative`:
2054: $$
2055: C_{V,\nabla^3}(\rho) = O(d_{\max} d'''_{\max}) + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-3})
2056: $$
2057: 
2058: For small $\rho$, the dominant term is $O(\rho^{2d-3})$.
2059: 
2060: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-patch-third-derivative`:
2061: $$
2062: C_{v,\nabla^3}(\rho) = L_{\sigma\'\'_{\text{reg}}} \cdot O(\rho^{2d-3}) + L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}} \cdot O(\rho^{2d-3}) = O(\rho^{2d-3})
2063: $$
2064: 
2065: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-zscore-third-derivative`, combining through the quotient rule:
2066: $$
2067: K_{Z,3}(\rho) = \frac{1}{\sigma\'_{\min}} \left[O(\rho^{6d-3}) + O(\rho^{6d-5}) + O(\rho^{6d-7})\right] = O(\rho^{6d-3})
2068: $$
2069: 
2070: (The structure $\rho^{6d-3}$ arises from three applications of derivatives, each contributing a $\rho^{2d-m}$ factor.)
2071: 
2072: **Step 2: Combine via the chain rule.**
2073: 
2074: From Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity`:
2075: $$
2076: K_{V,3}(\rho) = L_{g'''_A} \cdot (K_{Z,1}(\rho))^3 + 3 L_{g''_A} \cdot K_{Z,1}(\rho) \cdot K_{Z,2}(\rho) + L_{g'_A} \cdot K_{Z,3}(\rho)
2077: $$
2078: 
2079: Using the **corrected scalings** accounting for the $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ factor at each derivative order:
2080: - $K_{Z,1}(\rho) = O(\rho^{2d})$ (first derivative includes one $k_{\text{eff}}$ factor)
2081: - $K_{Z,2}(\rho) = O(\rho^{4d-2})$ (second derivative includes two factors)
2082: - $K_{Z,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d-3})$ (third derivative includes three factors - Step 1)
2083: 
2084: We have:
2085: - Cubic term: $L_{g'''_A} \cdot (K_{Z,1})^3 = O(1) \cdot O(\rho^{2d})^3 = O(\rho^{6d})$ (dominant for $d > 1$, subdominant for small $\rho$ when $d < 1/2$)
2086: - Mixed term: $3 L_{g''_A} \cdot K_{Z,1} \cdot K_{Z,2} = O(1) \cdot O(\rho^{2d}) \cdot O(\rho^{4d-2}) = O(\rho^{6d-2})$ (subdominant for small $\rho$)
2087: - Linear term: $L_{g'_A} \cdot K_{Z,3} = O(1) \cdot O(\rho^{6d-3}) = O(\rho^{6d-3})$ **← DOMINANT for small** $\rho$ **(smallest exponent)**
2088: 
2089: The **linear term dominates** for small $\rho$ (smallest exponent on $\rho$), giving:
2090: $$
2091: K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d-3}) \quad \text{for } \rho \to 0
2092: $$
2093: 
2094: **Step 3: Global limit ($\rho \to \infty$).**
2095: 
2096: As $\rho \to \infty$, the localization kernel becomes approximately uniform over the swarm:
2097: $$
2098: K_\rho(x, x') \to 1/|\mathcal{X}|
2099: $$
2100: 
2101: In this limit:
2102: - The weights $w_{ij}(\rho) \to 1/k$ (uniform over alive walkers)
2103: - The derivatives $\nabla w_{ij}(\rho) \to 0$ (no dependence on $x_i$)
2104: - Higher-order derivatives $\nabla^m w_{ij}(\rho) \to 0$ for $m \ge 1$
2105: 
2106: Thus:
2107: - $C_{w,3}(\rho) \to 0$ as $\rho \to \infty$
2108: - $C_{\mu,\nabla^3}(\rho) \to d'''_{\max}$ (only the direct derivative of $d(x_i)$ survives)
2109: - $K_{Z,3}(\rho) \to O(1)$ (bounded by measurement function derivatives)
2110: - $K_{V,3}(\rho) \to O(1)$

hints.label: prop-timestep-constraint
hints.title: Time Step Constraint from $C^3$ Regularity
hints.content:
2118: :label: prop-timestep-constraint
2119: 
2120: For the BAOAB integrator to maintain $O(\Delta t^2)$ weak error, the time step must satisfy:
2121: $$
2122: \Delta t \lesssim \frac{1}{\sqrt{K_{V,3}(\rho)}}
2123: $$
2124: 
2125: For small localization scales $\rho \to 0$, this gives:
2126: $$
2127: \Delta t \lesssim \rho^{3/2}
2128: $$

hints.label: proof-prop-timestep-constraint
hints.content:
2134: :label: proof-prop-timestep-constraint
2135: 
2136: The BAOAB weak error analysis (Theorem 1.7.2 in [04_convergence.md](../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md)) involves truncating the Itρ-Taylor expansion at second order. The truncation error depends on:
2137: $$
2138: \Delta t^2 \cdot \|\nabla^3 V\|
2139: $$
2140: 
2141: For the error to remain $O(\Delta t^2)$, we need:
2142: $$
2143: \Delta t^2 \cdot K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\Delta t^2)
2144: $$
2145: 
2146: This is automatically satisfied, but for the **discrete-time Markov chain** to be well-behaved (e.g., to avoid large jumps), we require the higher-order correction terms to be small:
2147: $$
2148: \Delta t \cdot \sqrt{K_{V,3}(\rho)} \lesssim 1
2149: $$
2150: 
2151: Using $K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{6d-3})$:
2152: $$
2153: \Delta t \lesssim \frac{1}{(K_{V,3}(\rho))^{1/2}} = O(\rho^{-(6d-3)/2})
2154: $$

hints.label: prop-explicit-k-v-3
hints.title: Explicit Formula for $K_{V,3}(\rho)$
hints.content:
2185: :label: prop-explicit-k-v-3
2186: 
2187: For the Gaussian kernel with constants $(d_{\max}, d'_{\max}, d''_{\max}, d'''_{\max}, A, L_{g'_A}, L_{g''_A}, L_{g'''_A}, \sigma\'_{\min})$, the third-derivative bound is:
2188: $$
2189: \begin{aligned}
2190: K_{V,3}(\rho) = &\, L_{g'_A} \cdot \frac{1}{\sigma\'_{\min}} \cdot \left[d'''_{\max} + \frac{6 d''_{\max}}{\rho} + \frac{6 d'_{\max}}{\rho^2} + \frac{C_{\max}}{\rho^3}\right] \\
2191: &+ 3 L_{g''_A} \cdot K_{Z,1}(\rho) \cdot K_{Z,2}(\rho) + L_{g'''_A} \cdot (K_{Z,1}(\rho))^3
2192: \end{aligned}
2193: $$
2194: 
2195: where $C_{\max}$ is a constant depending on $(d_{\max}, d'_{\max}, d''_{\max}, d'''_{\max})$ and kernel coefficients.
2196: 
2197: **Asymptotic behavior:**
2198: - As $\rho \to 0$: $K_{V,3}(\rho) \sim \frac{L_{g'_A} C_{\max}}{\sigma\'_{\min} \rho^3}$
2199: - As $\rho \to \infty$: $K_{V,3}(\rho) \sim \frac{L_{g'_A} d'''_{\max}}{\sigma\'_{\min}}$
hints.raw_directive:

2191: &+ 3 L_{g''_A} \cdot K_{Z,1}(\rho) \cdot K_{Z,2}(\rho) + L_{g'''_A} \cdot (K_{Z,1}(\rho))^3
2192: \end{aligned}
2193: $$
2194: 
2195: where $C_{\max}$ is a constant depending on $(d_{\max}, d'_{\max}, d''_{\max}, d'''_{\max})$ and kernel coefficients.
